test.name: route
test.objective: Route Table

test.name: epilogue
test.objective: Restore configuration after running routing tests.

test.name: rt_if_by_dst_dr
test.objective: Check that outgoing interface is correctly chosen based on destination address according to the information in the routing table - the case of direct route.

test.name: rt_if_by_dst_gw
test.objective: Check that outgoing interface is correctly chosen based on destination address according to the information in the routing table - the case of indirect route.

test.name: rt_many_subnets_via_gw
test.objective: Check that the routing is correctly done in case there are a set of routes to different subnetworks via different gateways.

test.name: rt_default
test.objective: Check that the default route is taken into account in routing decision.
test.notes: TE does not support (show) default routes.

result.verdict: Check after adding default route: Datagrams were received in a different order

test.name: rt_metric
test.objective: Check that metric of the route is taken into account while making the routing decision. The smaller the metric the better the route.

test.name: rt_prefix_vs_metric
test.objective: Check that the route netmask has higher priority than the route metric while making the routing decision.

test.name: rt_prefix_len_flexible
test.objective: Check that netmask of the route is taken into account while making the routing decision.

test.name: conn_changed_gw
test.objective: Check that TCP and UDP connections stay alive after changing the gateway providing access to the peer.

result.verdict: After gateway change, sending from IUT: Data was sent but peer socket is not readable
After gateway change: traffic over IUT interface is not accelerated
After gateway change: traffic over IUT interface is not accelerated

After gateway change, sending from IUT: Data was sent but peer socket is not readable
After gateway change, sending from IUT: Data was sent but peer socket is not readable

test.name: rt_src_addr
test.objective: Check that source address is taken into account for setting source address for outgoing packets and connecting.

test.name: rt_src_other_if
test.objective: Check what happens when route directs traffic over some interface but preferred source address specified for this route belongs to another interface.

test.name: rt_same_addr_if_down_up
test.objective: Using the same IP address on two interfaces with two mutually substitutable routes. Check that if one of interfaces goes down the second one is used without visible changes for user.

test.name: rt_same_addr_if_down_up_one_sock
test.objective: Using the same IP address on two interfaces with two mutually substitutable routes. Check that opened socket (bound and possibly connected) can send and receive traffic using alternative route if one of interfaces goes down.

test.name: pbr_oif_src
test.objective: Check that outgoing interface rule works for a socket which was bound to an interface, so that a route from selected table is used to determine source address.

results.notes: Expected behavior

result.verdict: Unexpected source address was reported by recvfrom() when socket was bound to an interface

test.name: pbr_oif_gw
test.objective: Check that outgoing interface rule works for a socket for which SO_BINDTODEVICE was set, so that a route from selected table is used to determine gateway.

test.name: tcp_loopback_alien
test.objective: Check that external incoming connections are handled correctly if the destination address belongs to loopback interface.

test.name: multipath_prologue
test.objective: Configure test hosts for multipath routes tests.

test.name: multipath_balancing
test.objective: Check that all paths of a multipath route are used for network connections, and frequency of using a specific path is proportional to its weight.

results.notes: Weighted IPv6 multipath routes are supported since 4.16 kernel

result.verdict: Real distribution of data among route paths differs too much from expected one
More than one connection sent the first packet over different path

results.notes: Expected behaviour when Onload feature is not enabled

result.verdict: Not accelerated traffic was detected over the first path
Not accelerated traffic was detected over the second path

test.name: multipath_add_del
test.objective: Check what happens when a path is added or removed in a multipath route.

result.verdict: The first route: More than one connection sent the first packet over different path
The second route: More than one connection sent the first packet over different path

results.notes: See also discussion in ST-2015

result.verdict: The first route: A single connection sent the first packet over different path
The second route: A single connection sent the first packet over different path

test.name: multipath_del_add_same_conns
test.objective: Check that existing connections remain functional after removing/restoring a path in a multipath route.

results.notes: See also discussion in ST-2015

result.verdict: The initial route: A single connection sent the first packet over different path
The route after restoring a path: A single connection sent the first packet over different path

results.notes: See also discussion in ST-2015

test.name: ../gateways_epilogue
test.objective: Epilogue used to reset interfaces after different gateway settings.

test.name: rt_switched_tos
test.objective: Check that a new route with specific TOS correctly directs the IP traffic on established connection.

test.name: asymmetric
test.objective: Check routing configuration when traffic is sent over one interface but received over another interface.

test.name: rt_hoplimit
test.objective: Check that if route hoplimit attribute is set, then IPv4 TTL or IPv6 Hop Limit header field is set to its value in sent packets unless IP_TTL (or IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS) specifies another value.

test.name: retransmit_change_route
test.objective: Check what happens if, while IUT is trying to retransmit an unaknowledged packet, route to the peer is changed to go over a different interface.

result.verdict: Peer did not become readable after changing route

test.name: blackhole
test.objective: Check that the connection is not established when a blackhole is set.

test.name: if_change_netns
test.objective: Check that data can be sent and received over an interface after moving it to/from a network namespace.

test.name: conn_changed_tos
test.objective: Check that if we send cmsg with set TOS or change TOS during UDP or TCP connection it goes to correct route.

results.notes: cmsg is not supported by Onload. See ST-2607 also.

result.verdict: Test send: recv() failed with RCF_PCH-ERPCTIMEOUT
